tool_description: Live Prices for metals including: Gold, Silver, Platinum, Palladium, copper, nickel, zinc, lead and aluminium. In 160+ currencies.
name: Metals.APISED
title: Metals.APISED

api_list.name: /v1/supported
api_list.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of supported metal and currency symbols. The request should be sent to https://metals-{{region-name}}.apised.com{{distribution-channel}}/v1/supported.

The response will have a status code of 200, indicating a successful request. The response body will include a JSON object with the following fields:
- "success": a boolean value indicating the success of the request
- "validationMessage": an array of validation messages, if any
- "supportedMetalSymbols": an array of objects containing information about supported metals, including "metal_code", "metal_name", and "metal_weight_measurement"
- "supportedCurrencySymbols": an array of objects containing information about supported currencies, including "currency_code" and "currency_name"

No request body is required for this endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://metals-apised.p.rapidapi.com/v1/supported"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "metals-apised.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://metals-apised.p.rapidapi.com/v1/supported"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "metals-apised.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /v1/latest
api_list.description:
# Retrieve Latest Metal Rates

This API endpoint allows you to retrieve the latest rates for various metals based on a specified base currency.

## Request

### Endpoint

`GET` [https://metals-{{region-name}}.apised.com{{distribution-channel}}/v1/latest](https://metals-{{region-name}}.apised.com{{distribution-channel}}/v1/latest)

### Query Parameters

- `symbols`: (string) Comma-separated list of metal symbols for which rates are to be retrieved (e.g. XAU,XAG,XPD,XPT,XCU,NI,ZNC,ALU)
- `base`: (string) The base currency for the rates (e.g. KWD)
    

## Response

- `success`: (boolean) Indicates if the request was successful.
- `validationMessage`: (array) An array of validation messages, if any.
- `baseCurrency`: (string) The base currency for the rates.
- `rates`: (object) Object containing the rates for each metal symbol.
    

### Sample Response

``` json
{
    "success": true,
    "validationMessage": [],
    "baseCurrency": "",
    "rates": {
        "XAU": 0,
        "XAG": 0,
        "XPD": 0,
        "XPT": 0,
        "XCU": 0,
        "NI": 0,
        "ZNC": 0,
        "ALU": 0
    }
}

 ```

api_list.name: /v1/carat
api_list.description:
This HTTP GET request retrieves information about the carat rates for a specific base currency in a particular region and distribution channel. The request should be made to [https://metals-{{region-name}}.apised.com{{distribution-channel}}/v1/carat](https://metals-{{region-name}}.apised.com{{distribution-channel}}/v1/carat) with the 'base' parameter specifying the base currency.

The response will have a status of 200 and will include a JSON object with the keys 'success', 'validationMessage', 'baseCurrency', and 'rates'. The 'success' key indicates the success of the request, 'validationMessage' provides any validation messages, 'baseCurrency' specifies the base currency, and 'rates' contains the carat rates for different purities of gold (XAU) in the specified base currency.

api_list.name: /v1/market-data
api_list.description:
### Retrieve Market Data

This endpoint retrieves market data for various metals based on the provided symbols and base currency.

#### Request

- Method: GET
- URL: `https://metals-{{region-name}}.apised.com{{distribution-channel}}/v1/market-data`
- Query Parameters:
    - symbols (string): Comma-separated list of metal symbols (e.g. XAU, XAG, XPD)
    - base (string): Base currency for the market data (e.g. EUR)

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Body:
    
    ``` json
    {
      "success": true,
      "validationMessage": [],
      "baseCurrency": "",
      "rates": {
        "XAU": {
          "open": 0,
          "high": 0,
          "low": 0,
          "prev": 0,
          "change": 0,
          "current": 0
        },
        "XAG": {
          "open": 0,
          "high": 0,
          "low": 0,
          "prev": 0,
          "change": 0,
          "current": 0
        },
        ...
      }
    }
    
     ```
